title: Adaptive Physical Education for Cerebral Palsy Students: Mathematical Project Design Based on Floor Time Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational physical education knowledge and understanding of disabilities, comprehension of basic mathematical concepts (measurement, graphs, statistics)
context.additional_context: Learners understand the physical characteristics of students with cerebral palsy and adaptive physical education methods, and develop the ability to design educational projects using the Floor Time approach. Using BYOD for collaboration and resource development, while employing spreadsheets and graphing tools to collect and analyze motor skill data.

learning_goals: Explain the core principles of the Floor Time approach and propose methods for analyzing motor skill improvement data in students with cerebral palsy using mathematical measurements (frequency, duration, angles, etc.).

Design an adaptive physical education program based on project-based learning, visualizing and optimizing lateral rolling ability enhancement strategies for students with cerebral palsy through statistical graphs (bar/line graphs).

Learners monitor the project process (research design, data analysis, result interpretation) through three formative assessments over one week, incorporate peer and instructor feedback, and derive five or more specific instructional design improvements. Basic statistical techniques such as mean, standard deviation, and correlation are utilized in this process.

resources: Cerebral Palsy Student Case Study Materials
Educational Videos on the Floor Time Approach
BYOD-Compatible Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Notion)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
